lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ted/Ted.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ted.Ted.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Ted is a chatbot for managing tasks.
In order to use Ted, you will need Java 11 installed in your computer.
Adds a task with a basic task description to Ted.
Ted will indicate successful addition to task list, as well as a count of all tasks currently in task list.
Adds a task with a task description and a deadline to Ted.
Ted will indicate successful addition to task list, as well as a count of all tasks currently in task list.
Adds a task with a task description and an event timing to Ted.
Example of usage: `event go for school /at friday 2-6pm`
Ted will indicate successful addition to task list, as well as a count of all tasks currently in task list.
Ted will indicate that task is not completed.
Ted will indicate task deletion, and display remaining task count.
Lists all tasks added to Ted.
Ted will display all tasks in task list.
Finds all tasks that contain the keyword entered by user.
Ted will display all tasks that contain the search keyword entered.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Ted will display tasks with upcoming deadlines.

| add event | `event [TASK] /at [TIME]`
e.g., `event go for school /at friday 2-6pm` |

* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
public static DialogBox getTedDialog(String text, Image img) {
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Represents a task bot called Ted. A Ted object interacts with user
* and keeps track of user's tasks.
+ "I'm Ted and I'm here to help you keep track of your tasks |._.|\n" + "How can I assist you today?\n";
* Creates Ted object to interact with user and keep track of tasks.
* @param filePath path to file with saved task list data.
* @param fileName name of file with saved task list data.
* Returns bot response to user input.
* Returns a welcome message to the user.
* Represents the bot's add command. A AddCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is added.
* Creates AddCommand object to add a specific task into the TaskList.
* @param task task to be added into bot TaskList.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is added.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Represents the bot's bye command. A ByeCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when user exits the bot program.
* Executes the necessary operations when user exits the program.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Represents commands that users can input to the bot.
public abstract String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException;
* Represents the bot's delete command. A DeleteCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is deleted.
* Creates DeleteCommand object pertaining to a specific task in the TaskList.
* @param taskIndex the task in the TaskList to be deleted.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is deleted.
* @throws TedException if error occurs while deleting task or updating file.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException {
* Represents the bot's find command. A FindCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when tasks from TaskList need to be found.
* Creates FindCommand object pertaining to a specific keyword to be searched for
* @param keyword the keyword to be searched for in TaskList.
* Executes the necessary operations when find is called by user.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Represents the bot's list command. A ListCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when TaskList is to be listed.
* Executes the necessary operations when list is called by user.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Represents the bot's mark command. A MarkCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is marked.
* Creates MarkCommand object pertaining to a specific task in the TaskList.
* @param taskIndex the task in the TaskList to be marked.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is marked.
* @throws TedException if error occurs while marking task or updating file.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException {
* Represents the bot's remind command. A RemindCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary to remind user of upcoming deadlines.
* Executes the necessary operations when remind is called by user.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) {
* Represents the bot's unmark command. A UnmarkCommand object, when executed,
* performs all the operations necessary when a task is unmarked.
* Creates UnmarkCommand object pertaining to a specific task in the TaskList.
* @param taskIndex the task in the TaskList to be unmarked.
* Executes the necessary operations when a task is unmarked.
* @throws TedException if error occurs while unmarking task or updating file.
public String execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage st) throws TedException {
* Represents exceptions that arise from the use of the bot.
* Creates TedException object with specific error message.
* Represents a parser for decoding user commands. Parser calls the
* correct Command according to the user input.
private static final String NONCOMMAND_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no, I don't understand T_T\n";
private static final String MISSING_TASKNUMBER_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no, please indicate task number T_T\n";
private static final String NO_TASK_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no, please include task description T_T\n";
private static final String MISSING_DESCRIPTION_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no, "
+ "please include both description and time T_T\n";
private static final String DATE_FORMAT_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no, "
+ "please input the date in yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm format T_T\n";
private static final String NO_KEYWORD_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no, enter a keyword to find tasks T_T\n";

* Represents storage of task list. A Storage object corresponds

* Returns TaskList after loading task data from file.
* @return TaskList with tasks saved in file.

* Updates file when changes occur to tasks in the file.

* Creates Deadline object that is specified to be done or not done.

* @return boolean that indicates whether user should be reminded of the particular Deadline object.

* Creates Event object with default not done status.
* Creates Event object that is specified to be done or not done.
* @param isTaskDone boolean indicating task's done status.
public Event(String taskDescription, boolean isTaskDone, String eventTimePeriod) {

* Returns Event in the correct String format to write to file.

* Returns Todo in the correct String format to write to file.
